performanceNotes.description: InContainer is a pure layout component with minimal overhead. No heavy computations or watchers.
performanceNotes.recommendation: Safe to use liberally throughout the application without performance concerns.

performanceNotes.description: Content in slots is only rendered when the slot is used. Unused slots don't add DOM overhead.
performanceNotes.recommendation: Use conditional slots (header, footer) only when needed to minimize DOM size.

accessibilityNotes.description: InContainer provides proper semantic structure with header, main content, and footer sections.
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Use semantic slot names (headerTitle, contentArea, footer) to maintain document outline.

accessibilityNotes.description: Container itself is not interactive, but provides structure for focusable content inside.
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Ensure interactive elements inside container are keyboard accessible.
accessibilityNotes.example: Use proper tab order for form elements inside container.

accessibilityNotes.description: Container background uses design system colors. Verify contrast with content.
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Test text contrast against container background, especially with custom themes.
accessibilityNotes.example: Use design system text colors that meet WCAG AA standards (4.5:1 ratio).
